main event: Two witnesses observed a streak of brilliant light and a second similar object moving rapidly in the sky over Potsdam, New York on July 10, 1959.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be about 3 feet long and 1 inch thick, with a space of about 1 foot between them.
The objects were moving rapidly in the western sky.
One of the witnesses reported seeing a brighter light at the front of the objects.
The witnesses watched the objects for about 2 minutes before they gradually grew faint and went out of sight.
The witness enclosed a newspaper clipping about similar sightings of unidentified flying objects by pilots in the northeastern U.S. and the Pacific.
